snippet: Although Republican opposition and community protests have slowed efforts to upgrade passenger service, policy experts and members of both parties also blame missteps by the Obama administration.
abstract: Transportation policy experts and members of both parties blame missteps by Obama administration for United States failure in high-speed rail projects; critics say instead of putting $11 billion directly into high-speed initiatives, administration made mistake of parceling out money to upgrade existing Amtrak service, which will allow trains to go no faster than 110 miles per hour; none of the money originally went to service in Northeast Corridor, most likely place for high-speed rail.
lead_paragraph: Although Republican opposition and community protests have slowed efforts to upgrade passenger service, policy experts and members of both parties also blame missteps by the Obama administration.

headline.main: $11 Billion Later, High-Speed Rail Is Inching Along
headline.print_headline: $11 Billion Later, High-Speed Rail Is Inching Along
